blocks.name: cvc
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the class of all complex vector spaces.
blocks.origin: const class cvc { CVecOLD }

blocks.content: Define the class of all complex vector spaces. (Contributed by NM, 3-Nov-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-vc(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cvc, copab(s0, s1, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), cablo), wf(cv(s1), cxp(cc, crn(cv(s0))), crn(cv(s0))), wral(s2, crn(cv(s0)), wa(wceq(co(nat1, cv(s1), cv(s2)), cv(s2)), wral(s3, cc, wa(wral(s4, crn(cv(s0)), wceq(co(cv(s3), cv(s1), co(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s4))), co(co(cv(s3), cv(s1), cv(s2)), cv(s0), co(cv(s3), cv(s1), cv(s4))))), wral(s4, cc, wa(wceq(co(co(cv(s3), caddc, cv(s4)), cv(s1), cv(s2)), co(co(cv(s3), cv(s1), cv(s2)), cv(s0), co(cv(s4), cv(s1), cv(s2)))), wceq(co(co(cv(s3), cmul, cv(s4)), cv(s1), cv(s2)), co(cv(s3), cv(s1), co(cv(s4), cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}

blocks.name: vcrel
blocks.content: The class of all complex vector spaces is a relation. (Contributed by NM, 17-Mar-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm vcrel() {
  |- wrel(cvc)
} = {
  relopabi(hs0, hs1, cvc, w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cablo), wf(cv(hs1), cxp(cc, crn(cv(hs0))), crn(cv(hs0))), wral(hs2, crn(cv(hs0)), wa(wceq(co(nat1, cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), cv(hs2)), wral(hs3, cc, wa(wral(hs4, crn(cv(hs0)), wceq(co(cv(hs3), cv(hs1), co(cv(hs2), cv(hs0), cv(hs4))), co(co(cv(hs3), cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), cv(hs0), co(cv(hs3), cv(hs1), cv(hs4))))), wral(hs4, cc, wa(wceq(co(co(cv(hs3), caddc, cv(hs4)), cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), co(co(cv(hs3), cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), cv(hs0), co(cv(hs4), cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), wceq(co(co(cv(hs3), cmul, cv(hs4)), cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), co(cv(hs3), cv(hs1), co(cv(hs4), cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))))))))))
  df-vc(hs0, hs1, hs2, hs3, hs4)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs3)
  diff.hs0.s(hs4)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs3)
  diff.hs1.s(hs4)

  diff.hs3.s(hs4)
}

  df-vc(hs0, hs1, hs2, hs3, hs4)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)

blocks.name: vciOLD
blocks.content: Obsolete version of ~ cvsi . The properties of a complex vector space, which is an Abelian group (i.e. the vectors, with the operation of vector addition) accompanied by a scalar multiplication operation on the field of complex numbers. The variable ` W ` was chosen because ` _V ` is already used for the universal class. (Contributed by NM, 3-Nov-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

thm isvcOLD(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (< c0, c1 > ∈ CVecOLD ↔(c0 ∈ AbelOp ∧(c1 :(ℂ × c2)→ c2)∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c2,((1[c1]s0)= s0 ∧ ∀(s1 ∈ ℂ,(∀(s2 ∈ c2,(s1[c1](s0[c0]s2))=((s1[c1]s0)[c0](s1[c1]s2)))∧ ∀(s2 ∈ ℂ,(((s1[+]s2)[c1]s0)=((s1[c1]s0)[c0](s2[c1]s0))∧((s1[×]s2)[c1]s0)=(s1[c1](s2[c1]s0))))))))))
  ⊣ c2 = ran(c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c2)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(< c0, c1 > ∈ CVecOLD, (c0 ∈ AbelOp ∧(c1 :(ℂ × c2)→ c2)∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c2,((1[c1]s0)= s0 ∧ ∀(s1 ∈ ℂ,(∀(s2 ∈ c2,(s1[c1](s0[c0]s2))=((s1[c1]s0)[c0](s1[c1]s2)))∧ ∀(s2 ∈ ℂ,(((s1[+]s2)[c1]s0)=((s1[c1]s0)[c0](s2[c1]s0))∧((s1[×]s2)[c1]s0)=(s1[c1](s2[c1]s0))))))))), (c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌))
  vcex(c0, c1)
  3adant3(c0 ∈ AbelOp, (c1 :(ℂ × c2)→ c2), ∀(s0 ∈ c2,((1[c1]s0)= s0 ∧ ∀(s1 ∈ ℂ,(∀(s2 ∈ c2,(s1[c1](s0[c0]s2))=((s1[c1]s0)[c0](s1[c1]s2)))∧ ∀(s2 ∈ ℂ,(((s1[+]s2)[c1]s0)=((s1[c1]s0)[c0](s2[c1]s0))∧((s1[×]s2)[c1]s0)=(s1[c1](s2[c1]s0)))))))), (c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌))
  jca((c0 ∈ AbelOp ∧(c1 :(ℂ × c2)→ c2)), c0 ∈ 𝕌, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  adantr(c0 ∈ AbelOp, (c1 :(ℂ × c2)→ c2), c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  elex(c0, cablo)
  ancoms(c0 ∈ AbelOp, (c1 :(ℂ × c2)→ c2), c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  sylan2((c1 :(ℂ × c2)→ c2), c0 ∈ AbelOp, c1 ∈ 𝕌, (ℂ × c2)∈ 𝕌)
  sylancr(c0 ∈ AbelOp, (ℂ × c2)∈ 𝕌, ℂ ∈ 𝕌, c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  cnex()
  syl(c0 ∈ AbelOp, c2 ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ GrpOp)
